page.title: 03ATTITUDES:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: There is a friendliness amongst people & a concern for all in these rural communities,so old age or ill health is not left unhelped:in spite of soc- ial & other changes,there is still time for the minor courtesies.Good community spirit lends support to loc- al functions & the parishes have the reputation for giving generously to charity.There is a strong attachment to the parish church both as an anc- ient & historic building & as a symbol of the community even though 'our' parsons have to be shared with neigh- bouring parishes & many people rarely attend services except for the festiv- als. Periodic attempts to combine 2 or more parishes to give 1 Parish Council or Parochial Church Council are res- isted & have always been unsuccessful. There is an obstinate determination to retain independence & identity.
